* Represents a Deadline task: a type of Task with a

*

A deadline stores a description and a due date. The due date
* is parsed from a string in the format {@code yyyy-MM-dd} and
* can be displayed in a more readable format.
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
* Constructs a Deadline task with the specified description and due date.
* @param description the description of the task
* @param by the due date in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format
* @throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException if the {@code by} string is not in the correct format
* Returns a string representation of the Deadline task,
* including the type indicator [D], its completion status,
* and the due date in readable format.
* @return a formatted string representing the Deadline
* Returns a string suitable for storage in a text file,
* including type, completion status, description, and due date
* @return a string representing the Deadline for storage
* Represents an Event task, which is a type of Task that has
* a start date and an end date.

*

An Event stores a description, a start date, and an end date.
* Both dates are parsed from strings in the format {@code yyyy-MM-dd}
* and can be displayed in a more readable format.
private static final DateTimeFormatter OUTPUT_FORMAT = DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("MMM dd yyyy");
* Constructs an Event task with the specified description, start date, and end date.
* @param description the description of the event
* @param from the start date in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format
* @param to the end date in {@code yyyy-MM-dd} format
* @throws java.time.format.DateTimeParseException if either date string is not in the correct format
public Event(String description, String from, String to) {
* Returns a string representation of the Event task,
* including the type indicator [E], its completion status,
* and the start and end dates in readable format.
* @return a formatted string representing the Event
* Returns a string suitable for storage in a text file,
* including type, completion status, description, start date, and end date
* @return a string representing the Event for storage
* A utility class for parsing user input commands.

*

This class provides methods to extract the command word
* from a full input string entered by the user.
* Handles loading and saving tasks to disk.

*

The Storage class is responsible for reading tasks from a file
* and writing tasks back to the file. If the file or its parent
* directories do not exist, they are created automatically.
* Constructs a Storage object for the specified file path.
* @param path the file path where tasks will be stored
* Loads tasks from the storage file.

*

If the file does not exist, returns an empty list. Lines
* that cannot be parsed into Task objects are ignored.
* @return a list of tasks loaded from the file
* Saves the given list of tasks to the storage file.

*

If the parent directories do not exist, they are created.
* Each task is written as a single line using {@link Task#toStorageString()}.
* @param tasks the list of tasks to save
* Represents a general task with a description and completion status.

*

This is the base class for specific task types such as {@link ToDo},
* {@link Deadline}, and {@link Event}. It provides common functionality
* such as marking tasks as done/undone and converting tasks to and from
* Constructs a Task with the specified description.
* The task is initially not done.
* @param description the description of the task
* Returns a one-character status icon for the task.
* @return "X" if the task is done, otherwise a space " "
* Returns a string representation of the task for display purposes.
* Includes a status icon and the task description.
* @return a formatted string representing the task
* Returns a string suitable for storage in a text file.
* The base implementation is for a {@link ToDo} task.
* Subclasses should override this method to include additional data.
* @return a string representing the task for storage
* Creates a {@link Task} object from a storage string.

*

The string should follow the format produced by {@link #toStorageString()},
* e.g., "T | 1 | Description" for a ToDo, or similar for Deadline/Event.
* @param line the storage string representing a task
* @return a Task object corresponding to the storage string
* @throws IllegalArgumentException if the task type is unknown

*

This class wraps a {@link List} of {@link Task} objects and provides
* methods to add, remove, and access tasks. It serves as the main container
* for tasks in the Bossa application.
* Constructs a TaskList with an existing list of tasks.
* @param tasks the initial list of tasks
* Returns the list of all tasks.
* Adds a task to the TaskList.
* Removes and returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index the index of the task to remove
* Returns the task at the specified index.
* @param index the index of the task to retrieve
* @return the task at the given index
* Returns the number of tasks in the TaskList.
* @return the size of the task list
* Represents a ToDo task, a type of Task without a specific date or time.

*

A ToDo stores only a description and its completion status.

* @param description the description of the task
* Returns a string representation of the ToDo task,
* including the type indicator [T] and its completion status.
* @return a formatted string representing the ToDo
* Returns a string suitable for storage in a text file,
* including type, completion status, and description.
* @return a string representing the ToDo for storage
